intro: Urachne simplex var. peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian urachne, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple and white. The plant has slender, ascending stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
